    • Method Detail

      • getDiffuseContribution

        float getDiffuseContribution()
        Returns relative contribution of different reflection types. This is used by the integrators to determine which type to sample.

      • getReflectContribution

        float getReflectContribution()

      • getRefractContribution

        float getRefractContribution()

      • evaluateDiffuseBRDF

        Spectrum evaluateDiffuseBRDF(HitRecord hitRecord,
                           javax.vecmath.Vector3f wOut,
                           javax.vecmath.Vector3f wIn)
        Evaluate BRDF for each reflection type.
        Parameters:
        hitRecord - Information about hit point
        wOut - Outgoing direction, normalized and pointing away from the surface
        wIn - Incoming direction, normalized and pointing away from the surface
        Returns:
        BRDF value

      • evaluateSpecularBRDF

        Spectrum evaluateSpecularBRDF(HitRecord hitRecord,
                            javax.vecmath.Vector3f wOut,
                            javax.vecmath.Vector3f wIn)

      • evaluateRefractiveBRDF

        Spectrum evaluateRefractiveBRDF(HitRecord hitRecord,
                              javax.vecmath.Vector3f wOut,
                              javax.vecmath.Vector3f wIn)

      • evaluateEmission

        Spectrum evaluateEmission(HitRecord hitRecord,
                        javax.vecmath.Vector3f wOut)

      • sampleDiffuse

        javax.vecmath.Vector3f sampleDiffuse(HitRecord hitRecord,
                                   float[] sample)
        Sample an incident direction for each reflection type. The length of the returned vector is the sample probability density (pdf).

      • sampleReflect

        javax.vecmath.Vector3f sampleReflect(HitRecord hitRecord,
                                   float[] sample)

      • sampleRefract

        javax.vecmath.Vector3f sampleRefract(HitRecord hitRecord,
                                   float[] sample)

      • mirrorReflect

        boolean mirrorReflect()
        Return whether material has perfect mirror reflection and refraction.

      • mirrorRefract

        boolean mirrorRefract()
